result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard W Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Financial obligation owed is to be paid from all funds received into defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

superMiscConds.notes:
To be determined.

  Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the agent but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment.

No contact with the victim & victims direct family unless approved by DOC. No cotnact with any children under the age of 18.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Sex offender registry - lifetime.

STC: 12/11/14 @ 10am (EML)
Rust addresses bond - He is staying with his aunt in Galesville.  He is care provider for his grandmother who lives in La Crosse.  He is asking to provide care for the grandmother.  It is the only place he will be going in La Crosse.  The alleged victim goes to school near the grandmother's home.  It is not within the exclusion zone.   He has been offered a job at Ashley. 
Minser comments - don't have any problem with any of this as long as the school is part of the exclusion zone. 
CT:  He is allowed to go to grandmother's as care taker.  He is to avoid the exclusion zone.  The perimeter of the exclusion zone is near the grandmother's home.
